author: pburba
msg: Add a new merge_authz test for reintegrate merges and issue #3242.
See http://subversion.tigris.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=3242#desc78
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_authz_tests.py

(test_list): Add reintegrate_fails_if_no_root_access, set as XFail.

author: lhazlewood
msg: SHIRO-162: Created SessionContext interface and implementations to mirror SubjectContext concept.  SessionManager.start was changed to return a Session instead of a Serializable sessionId because not all environments can support Session acquisition by ID (e.g. servlet container environments).

author: kaosko
msg: FIXED - issue SHIRO-163: ModularRealmAuthorizer.setRealms needs to call applyRolePermissionResolverToRealms
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SHIRO-163
- applied attached path

author: marvin
msg: Fix problem with corruption of the Perl stack by Host_callback().
A copy of the Perl stack pointer was saved prior to invoking call_method();
this value was then inappropriately restored via PUTBACK after call_method()
returned.  There was in fact no reason to be manipulating the stack pointer
around call_method() at all, as call_method() handles the stack variables
itself.  (Bracketing stack manipulation macros like POPs that manipulate the
local copy of the stack pointer with dSP/SPAGAIN and PUTBACK is necessary, but
wrapping call_method(), call_sv(), etc. is harmful.) Storing the now-obsolete
value into PL_stack_sp via PUTBACK did nothing but corrupt the stack.  The
solution was simply to delete that PUTBACK.
Additionally, when prepping callbacks into Perl from Host.c, invoke EXTEND
once and then use PUSHs for each arg, rather than using XPUSHs (which contains
EXTEND) for each arg.

author: marvin
msg: Port several improvements to the Perl build, contributed by Peter Karman:
* Quote the $cc value in case it is multiple terms (as with "ccache cc").
* Allow for --config cc=cc to override in initial Build.PL call.
* Pass any --config cc=xxxx settings through to CBuilder.
* Avoid accessing $Config directly so that params can be overridden per
Module::Build docs.
* Use inside-out object pattern to track "cc" since CBuilder does not have a
config() accessor.
